page.title: 13TECHNOLOGY IN 1985 cont...
page.content: energy level and consumption. The hand brake locks for parking on gradients and there's even a key operated ignition switch. It is advertised that it can go almost 1,000 miles for the price of a gallon of pertrol. It is also advertised that you can park 5 C5's in the space taken up by a family saloon car and that the turning space is less than 2/3 of a mini's. The brains behind the whole operation are those of Sir Clive Sinclair the head man at Sinclair Research and Sinclair Vehicles. Sir Clive is hoping to follow up the C5 with a 2 seater C10 within 2 years and a pear_shaped 4 seater. At the time of writing Robert Maxwell is buying 3/4 of the company.
